controls.label: Does your program establish circumstances under which a customer may be identified using alternative identity proofing processes if they lack standard identity documentation?
controls.detail-label: Describe the circumstances (e.g. customer lacks documentation, cannot obtain it, or cannot produce it due to COVID-19 Pandemic measures) under which you use alternative proofing.

controls.label: Are your alternative identity proofing processes designed in accordance with your risk-based systems and controls?
controls.detail-label: Explain how you integrate risk assessment into the design and application of alternative proofing methods.

controls.label: Does your program include a procedure to collect multiple types of secondary identification documents when primary documentation is not available?
controls.detail-label: Describe the types of secondary identification documents your program accepts and the minimum number or combination required.

controls.label: Does your program include a procedure to accept self-attestation from customers when unable to establish identity through standard or alternative methods?
controls.detail-label: Describe what information the customer must certify in their self-attestation and how you document and retain this attestation.

controls.label: Does your program include procedures to verify alternative identity information obtained from customers, including self-attestations?
controls.detail-label: Describe your verification procedures for alternative identity information (e.g. cross-referencing, ongoing monitoring, additional inquiries).

controls.label: When you cannot obtain an original or certified copy of a document due to COVID-19 Pandemic measures, does your program allow acceptance of a document copy in accordance with your risk-based systems and controls?
controls.detail-label: Describe the circumstances under which you accept uncertified copies and how you assess the associated ML/TF risk.

controls.label: Does your program apply appropriate levels of ongoing customer due diligence to customers whose identity was established using self-attestation?
controls.detail-label: Describe the ongoing due diligence procedures you apply to identify, mitigate and manage ML/TF risk for these customers.

controls.label: Does your program include procedures to prevent reliance on self-attestation when you know or have reason to believe it is incorrect or misleading?
controls.detail-label: Describe the mechanisms you use to identify and respond to false or misleading self-attestations (e.g. verification checks, verification failures, suspicious indicators).

controls.label: Does your staff understand that criminal or civil penalties under the AML/CTF Act may apply to customers providing false or misleading identity information?
Is your definition of 'COVID-19 Pandemic measures' consistent with the regulatory definition (government-implemented/recommended measures, or reasonable measures by your entity or relevant persons)?
controls.detail-label: Describe how your program defines and applies 'COVID-19 Pandemic measures' including reasonable measures adopted domestically or in foreign locations where you operate.

groups.title: Scope and Eligibility for Alternative Identity Proofing
groups.description: Determine whether alternative identity proofing processes are available and applicable to your customers based on their circumstances.

groups.title: Collection of Alternative Identity Information
groups.description: Procedures for collecting alternative forms of identity information when standard CDD requirements cannot be met.

groups.title: Verification of Alternative Identity Information
groups.description: Processes for verifying identity information obtained through alternative methods, including self-attestation and document handling during COVID-19 disruptions.

groups.title: Risk Assessment and Ongoing Monitoring
groups.description: Risk-based decision-making and ongoing customer due diligence for customers identified through alternative methods.

groups.title: Discrepancy Handling and Validation
groups.description: Procedures for detecting and responding to false or misleading information in alternative identity proofing processes.
